name: Siwa Oasis
description: Located in Egypt’s Western Desert, Siwa is known for its salt lakes, hot springs, palm groves.

name: White Desert
description: A protected area in Farafra featuring stunning white rock. A surreal landscape perfect for camping and stargazing.

name: Ras Mohammed National
description: Located in South Sinai, this marine protected area is one of the top diving spots in the world with vibrant coral reef.

name: Blue Hole
description: A world-famous diving site on the Red Sea, ideal for experienced divers and underwater photography lovers.

name: Wadi El Rayan
description: A natural reserve with Egypt’s only waterfalls, large lakes, and surrounding sand dunes great for swimming and sandboarding.

name: Mount Sinai
description: A sacred mountain with religious significance, popular for sunrise hikes and panoramic desert views.

name: Gebel Elba
description: A remote mountain range in southeastern Egypt, rich in biodiversity and home to rare wildlife.

name: Fayoum Oasis
description: Famous for its lakes, bird-watching, and traditional pottery villages like Tunis Village.

name: Valley of the Whales
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site in Wadi Al-Hitan featuring fossilized remains of ancient whales.

name: Dahab Blue Lagoon
description: A tranquil, clear-water beach in Dahab ideal for relaxing, kite surfing, and snorkeling.

name: Bahariya Oasis
description: A lush oasis in the desert surrounded by black desert hills and ancient tombs.

name: St. Catherine’s Monastery
description: One of the oldest working Christian monasteries, located at the foot of Mount Sinai.
